title: Add multi-repository support for dashboard data collection
body:
Extends the dashboard to aggregate issues/PRs from mono/SkiaSharp, mono/SkiaSharp.Extended, and mono/skia with filtering support.

### Cache Structure
- Repo-scoped subfolders: `{owner}-{repo}/github/`, `{owner}-{repo}/community/`
- `CacheService.ForRepo(path, repo)` factory for scoped access
- `ReposConfig` model defines tracked repos with sync flags

```csharp
// Load data from specific repo
var repoCache = CacheService.ForRepo(cachePath, repo);
var index = await repoCache.LoadGitHubIndexAsync();
```

### Model Changes
- `IssueInfo` / `PullRequestInfo`: added `Repo`, `RepoShortName` fields
- `IssuesData` / `PrTriageData`: added `ByRepo` aggregation list
- `RepoDefinition`: `SyncIssues`, `SyncCommunity`, `SyncNuGet`, `IsPrimary` flags

### GenerateCommand
- Loads repos from config, iterates all repo folders
- Merges items with source repo info, aggregates stats per-repo
- Deduplicates contributors across repos

### Dashboard UI
- Repository filter dropdown on Issues and PRs pages
- Filter state persisted in URL query params

### Workflow
- Syncs GitHub items from all 3 repos
- Community sync for SkiaSharp + SkiaSharp.Extended
- NuGet/engagement sync primary repo only (rate limit management)

| Repository | Issues | Community | NuGet | Primary |
|------------|:------:|:---------:|:-----:|:-------:|
| mono/SkiaSharp | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ | ✓ |
| mono/SkiaSharp.Extended | ✓ | ✓ | | |
| mono/skia | ✓ | | | |

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> We need to extend this dashboard to include related reps. We have mono/skia and mono/SkiaSharp.Extended. Investigate how we could do this. Maybe our cache should be moved into sub folders for each repo and then we have data generation that loads it all up and renders it. I would think we want a mix of all issues, and then filters to pick one or more of the repos. Investigate and think deeply. Design an amazing solution. Look at the instructions docs and memory banks for how we currently work. Then provide some good solutions and for each solution weigh up pros and cons. Pick the best solution and implement it.
